strategy_reasoning: Using a 'Retro Game Patch Notes' theme fits the technical nature of the updates (dashboards, security fixes, deployment docs) while maintaining the cozy, non-intimidating brand voice. Visualizing complex dev updates as game UI elements (stats screens, title screens, repair quests) makes them accessible and engaging for the Gen-Z audience.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title screen saying 'PATCH NOTES' in chunky retro font. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient background with floating 8-bit cherry blossom petals. A tiny pixel bee cursor hovers over a 'Start' button. Warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic like Stardew Valley title screen. Nostalgic, welcoming, beautiful.
images.description: Title card establishing the retro game theme

images.prompt: Retro 8-bit game UI showing a 'Stats Menu' on a CRT monitor. Pixelated bar charts and data lines in lime green (#ecf874) and purple against a dark background. Header text 'TIER COSTS' in pixel font. Looks like a financial management screen in a cozy simulation game. Soft scanlines, warm glow.
images.description: Visualizing the new Tier Costs dashboard as a game stats screen

images.prompt: A tiny 8-bit pixel art bee character wearing a construction hat, holding a wrench, fixing a glitchy purple pixel block. Soft pastel mint and peach gradient background. Wholesome vibes, cute and determined character. Represents security fixes and bug squashing. Chunky sprites, warm lighting.
images.description: Illustrating the security fixes and bug squashing
